name: Mitchel Camacho
label: Student passionate about all things fintech
summary: Hi! My name is Mitchel Camacho, and I am a student at the University of Hawaii at Manoa pursuing a degree in Finance and Management Information Systems.

highlights: Conducted exploratory data analysis on publicly available datasets, examining the effects of vaccination (or lack thereof) on public health through variables like case counts, infection rates, and vaccination status to uncover meaningful insights.

Leveraged AI tools such as ChatGPT and Claude to guide data discovery, generate research prompts, and support the creation of visualizations, dashboards, and reports on the effects of having a vaccinated population.
Learning Coach for the Housekeeping Department. Responsible for training and equipping housekeepers with the skills and knowledge to perform world-class hospitality.
Established personal relationships with guests, contributing to positive guest feedback and loyalty.
Solved guest problems effectively and autonomously.
Implemented solutions to improve room aesthetics and guest satisfaction.
Utilized social media and digital marketing tactics to build brand awareness, attract new customers, and drive traffic to my stores.
Applied algorithm-driven tactics to refine ad performance, enhancing ad visibility to high-intent audiences and driving a significant increase in conversion rates.
Achieved over 200 sales within three months of operation, generating more than $2,000 in revenue.

work_experience.company: MATRIC (Mid-Atlantic Technology, Research, and Innovation Center)
highlights: Created GIS web applications with ActionScript and the ArcGIS API for Flex.
Developed custom widgets for routing, wind data visualization, and simulations.
Wrote and maintained SQL-based queries to efficiently retrieve and analyze data from GIS REST services.

projects.title: Educational Content Creator on YouTube
projects.summary: Channel focused on creating tutorials and walkthroughs for software developers, programmers, and engineers.

volunteer_experience.summary: Helped residents with any computer problems for two hours each week. Mainly helped with networking, typing, basic instruction, and troubleshooting.
Gave campus tours, organized promotional events, and ran summer orientation.

degrees: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
honors: Placed in a District ACM ICPC Team Programming Contest
